You've got somewhere in the vicinity of 75 from which to choose.", "For a would-be frightfest built around a supernatural premise, One Missed Call is so glum and businesslike that it's not nearly as much pulpy fun as it should be.", 'Give this call a miss.', "Given all the hoopla over the Apple iPhone, it's a wonder that no one has yet complained over an essential missing feature: It doesn't ring you up to alert you that you are going to die.", 'If you missed the first One Missed Call, made in Japan in 2004, you now can miss the American remake.', 'One big miss of a horror movie.', "The best part of the movie is the fact that, at a running time of an hour and a half, it's mercifully short.", "The direction is uninspired, acting is lifeless, and the script borders on the inept. A PG-13 rating means that it's short on shocks, too.", 'The script appears to blatantly rip-off plot devices and story elements from The Ring, but screenwriter Andrew Klavan avoids plagiarism by tacking on an incomprehensible second ending where Ring would have left off.', "The worst part about this movie is that, even though it's impossible to piece everything together logically, it's easy to see where it's going because there's nothing new here. There's a sameness to all these Japanese-turned-American retreads.", 'Those coming to One Missed Call in search of ground-breaking horror have definitely dialed the wrong number.', "To redial applicable catchphrases, this garbled American remake of Takashi Miike's already staticky 2004 exercise in J-horror is a wrong number.", "When it comes to scary movies, the Japanese have it figured out. Unfortunately, commercial filmmakers in the United States usually don't."]

title: Transylmania
movie_description: College students arrive at a Romanian castle for a semester abroad, unaware that the place is infested with vampires.
critical_consensus: Never aiming higher than threadbare jokes and offensive attempts at politically incorrect humor, Transylmania is a vampire comedy that truly sucks.
review: ['A no-stars, no-plot, no-point vampire spoof about a group of coeds studying abroad in a haunted castle, Transylmania boasts the kind of acting and direction usually relegated to the adult section of your local video store.', "David and Scott Hillenbrand's stoner horror-comedy predictably provides more groans than laughs. The filmmakers had better pray someone in the theater is holding, if you know what we mean.", 'Energetic but uninspired mix of teen comedy and supernatural silliness.', 'If your idea of a good time is laughing with repulsion at a humpbacked Romanian nympho with a torture-loving midget dad, or tittering every time a bong appears, a darkened theater awaits you.', "It's destined to spend a short and painful life in theaters and then join the ranks of the DVD and late-night-cable undead.", 'Lame vampire spoof has no bite.', 'One laugh -- Vampires, stuffed in their coffins on a horse-drawn wagon, whining to the driver -- "Are ve DERE yet?"', 'Transylmania is such a colossal comedic misfire that it makes the execrable Scary Movie films look like masterworks of Preston Sturges-esque genius by comparison.', 'Woefully dull-witted.']

title: Dark Tide
movie_description: A traumatized shark expert (Halle Berry) must battle her own fears to lead a thrill-seeking businessman on a dive into a dangerous section of water known as "Shark Alley."
critical_consensus: Shallow and brackish, Dark Tide fails to rise.
review: ["If you watch closely during John Stockwell's godawful shark-attack thriller, you can see Halle Berry's Oscar sinking ever so slowly into the waters off Cape Town.", "It is often impossible to figure out what's going on.", 'The only palpable emotion from "Dark Tide" is sadness for Berry, treading water in dreary efforts like this.', 'The sharks themselves are the only ones to emerge with credit from this.', "This thriller isn't an outright embarrassment, but it nonetheless suffers from wobbly dramatic tension and an overlong running time.", 'This toothless shark thriller lacks B-movie fun.']

title: A Thousand Words
movie_description: Jack McCall (Eddie Murphy) is a selfish literary agent whose fast-talking ways allow him to close any deal. His next target is New Age guru Dr. Sinja (Cliff Curtis), but the savvy doctor sees right through Jack. A magical tree appears in Jack's yard, and, according to Dr. Sinja, the tree and Jack are connected; every time Jack says a word, a leaf falls from the tree. When the last leaf drops, Jack will die. With just a thousand leaves left, Jack must learn to curb his speech or he's a goner.
critical_consensus: Dated jokes (A Thousand Words was shot in 2008) and removing Eddie Murphy's voice -- his greatest comedic asset -- dooms this painful mess from the start.
review: ['A Thousand Words is not worth any more dismissive words. It needs to make like a tree and leave.', 'A Thousand Words marks yet another lazy, "family-friendly" comedy in which Murphy phones it in -- remember when this guy was dangerously funny? -- and wastes the talents of a supporting cast that also includes Allison Janney and Jack McBrayer.', 'A disastrous comedy at times, with a few unexpected touching moments sprinkled throughout, A Thousand Words fails to come together like it should, and becomes a forgettable mess.', 'Does Eddie Murphy actually have any range, or is it just an illusion created by a few early edgy roles and, later, a lot of CGI makeup and fat suits?', 'Eddie Murphy should have just said the word "No" to this tired, formulaic comedy.', 'Even 2003 Robin Williams would have thunked this script in the fireplace by page 50.', "Even Murphy's largely wordless, physically adroit performance can't redeem this tortured exercise in high-concept spiritualist hokum.", 'Even when "A Thousand Words" is counseling us to just be quiet and in the moment, it can\'t just be quiet and in the moment.', "Follows directly in the footsteps of Bruce Almighty, Click, Liar Liar, Groundhog Day and any other post-Freaky Friday high-concept redemption story that inevitably crossed Tim Allen and Adam Sandler's desks at some point.", 'In the simplicity of its premise it embodies the notion of high-concept entertainment. In its execution it demonstrates how technical efficiency can drain the life from a story.', "It isn't a horrible movie, at least not in comparison to Norbit from the same star and director, but it is a dispiritingly dull and cynical one.", 'It makes you want to see Murphy team up with Judd Apatow, or even take on a dead-serious dramatic role - do anything but star in another movie like this one.', 'Only the most masochistic connoisseurs of the truly awful need check it out.', 'Remember Eddie Murphy? He used to be hilarious.', "Sometimes it's hard to tell quite where the incisions start and stop throughout this already uneven creation.", "The concept is unoriginal, the scenarios aren't funny, and its message is banal. Plus, Murphy alternately hams it up and phones it in.", 'The high concept breeds lowbrow gags.', 'The idea of Murphy, that famously motormouthed actor, suddenly tongue-tied is not a punchy enough punch line to carry a whole film.', "The idea of taking one of Hollywood's best-known motor-mouths and reducing him to mugging and charades is definitely novel - and utterly misguided.", "What you don't have is a funny movie."]

title: Cabin Fever
movie_description: Fresh out of college, five friends (Nadine Crocker, Matthew Daddario, Samuel Davis) face the horrors of a flesh-eating virus while staying at a remote cabin.
critical_consensus: No need for a quarantine -- enthusiasm for this inert remake is not contagious.
review: ['For fans of graphic horror only.', "I watched this, so you don't have to.", "In the end, there's little else to say, this new Cabin Fever a bloody misfire that shouldn't even exist in the first place.", 'One to avoid.', "Roth isn't exactly known for being critically defensible or for exercising directorial restraint, but Travis Z somehow manages to up the gore quotient.", "Roth's charcoal sense of humor is missing, the cruel irony lacking its hellish zing.", "Scene for scene, line for line, gag for gag, it's basically the same movie. And the original was no masterpiece to begin with.", "This dud sets a new standard for the term 'pointless remake.'", 'Travis Zariwny predictably scrubs all the edges and eccentricities down, however, fashioning another impersonally polished cover jam.', 'Who benefits from the existence of this film?', "Zariwny lacks Roth's love for peeling flesh and tar-colored blood-geysers, making this all feel weirdly pointless."]

title: The Disappointments Room
movie_description: Dana (Kate Beckinsale), her husband David and their 5-year-old son Lucas start a new life after moving from the hustle and bustle of Brooklyn, N.Y., to a stately old manor in the quiet countryside. After settling in, Dana starts to experience terrifying visions and dreams that she cannot explain. The mystery grows when she stumbles upon a secret room in the attic. After finding the key and unlocking the door, Dana discovers the dark history of the family that lived there in the 19th century.
critical_consensus: The Disappointments Room lives down to its title with a thrill-free thriller that presumably left its stars filled with regret - and threatens to do the same for audiences.
review: ['A litany of embarrassments best left shielded from audiences.', "Despite Kate Beckinsale's game efforts, D.J. Caruso's thriller proves altogether worthy of its title.", "Disappointments has the strange confidence of a much slicker, more decisive movie, and all of its sort-ofs don't add up to much.", 'The Disappointments Room lives (and dies) up to its name.', "There simply aren't enough scares to build tension throughout. Most of the film is just Beckinsale walking around looking worried.", "There simply isn't enough freshness in the script to warrant another journey inside a dark old house.", 'This spooky house flick would be better off locked up in the attic and forgotten for good.']

title: Precious Cargo
movie_description: Dana (Kate Beckinsale), her husband David and their 5-year-old son Lucas start a new life after moving from the hustle and bustle of Brooklyn, N.Y., to a stately old manor in the quiet countryside. After settling in, Dana starts to experience terrifying visions and dreams that she cannot explain. The mystery grows when she stumbles upon a secret room in the attic. After finding the key and unlocking the door, Dana discovers the dark history of the family that lived there in the 19th century.
critical_consensus: The Disappointments Room lives down to its title with a thrill-free thriller that presumably left its stars filled with regret - and threatens to do the same for audiences.
review: ["A straight-to-video nightmare is all that's on offer here.", 'Bruce Willis should really know better.', 'Bullets fly, curses are hurled, Willis threatens some chumps.', 'Precious Cargo is a rip-off and a rerun.', 'The film is fun in its own cheesy way, reminiscent of straight to video action movies of the Eighties but scarcely deserves a cinema release.', 'The stupid plot, dismal dialogue, moral turpitude and dispiriting torpor of this movie makes watching it utterly pointless.', 'This lazily directed and sloppily written heist non-thriller unspools like one of those amusement park distractions where tourists play at being in a movie.', "This production clearly ploughed all its budget into a few slick action sequences and the cameo from Willis. It's a pity the film-makers didn't invest in the screenplay.", "Two late-80s icons go head-to-head in Precious Cargo: Die Hard's Bruce Willis and Mark-Paul Gosselaar. If that latter name doesn't, um, ring a bell, think Zack Morris. It's the onscreen match absolutely nobody asked for.", 'You will be hard-pressed to remember anything about it even only a few minutes after watching it, which should come as a relief to everyone involved with its production.']

title: Gotti
movie_description: Raised on the streets of New York, young John Gotti found his way into the Gambino crime family, eventually having the boss removed and becoming head of the powerful family. His wife asked only one thing from John: to never expose their children to his profession. But he broke the vow, and John Jr. took his place as his father's Capo.
critical_consensus: Fuhgeddaboudit.
review: ["'Listen to me, and listen to me good. You never gonna see another guy like me if you live to be five thousand,' Travolta's Teflon Don boasts in the final scene. With any luck, we'll never see another mob-movie misfire like this either.", "A comically terrible imitation of a biopic, directed by Kevin Connolly with all the flair and nuance of a movie-within-a-movie on 'Entourage.'", "Admittedly, Travolta, who produced, is sure having fun. What ham wouldn't? Chewing on the scenery like it was a meatball hero, he swaggers around in shiny suits and silver wigs, barking orders.", 'Aside from the wardrobe and the makeup, "Gotti" falls far short of capturing period-piece details and never immerses us in the era.', "Closing reportage of everyday New Yorkers brashly extolling Gotti's virtues upon his death, painting him, without any irony, as some kind of local hero, pretty much tells you where this picture's coming from.", "Gotti is a connect-the-dots disaster -- the don's greatest hits, so to speak -- without discernible theme or cohesive narrative.", 'Gotti tries too hard to cram too much information into a small space, and you come away learning almost nothing about the man, other than the filmmakers feel he was a pretty stand-up guy.', 'He looks distractingly terrible at every stop...You never forget that you are watching John Travolta playing John Gotti every time.', 'He may have been a murderer, but even Gotti deserved better than this.', 'I\'d rather wake up next to a severed horse head than ever watch "Gotti" again.', "It's almost laughable to see this iconic star trying so hard on behalf of a movie that is so clearly compromised in its intentions.", "It's more run-of-the-mill than it is colossally misguided.", "It's not a good movie. But the blame can't be laid at its star's Ferragamo-shod feet.", 'Starring in this mobster biopic that deserves to get whacked is an offer Travolta should have refused. Insane testimonials from Gotti supporters at the end are as close as this s---show will ever get to good reviews.', 'That the long-gestating crime drama Gotti is a dismal mess comes as no surprise. What does shock is just how multifaceted a dismal mess it is.', 'The film is pretty terrible: poorly written, devoid of tension, ridiculous in spots and just plain dull in others.', "The problem is that it's not really anything. This is a strange thing to say about a notorious mob boss who was locked up for murder, but John Gotti deserved better.", "When Gotti tells viewers, speaking directly to the camera at film's end, that they'll never see another man like him, an attorney should really spring up and object that the statement assumes facts not in evidence.", "You might think this sounds hilariously bad. It must be so bad it's kind of good, right? Wrong. Gotti is not remotely fun, even ironically."]

title: John Henry
movie_description: Raised on the streets of New York, young John Gotti found his way into the Gambino crime family, eventually having the boss removed and becoming head of the powerful family. His wife asked only one thing from John: to never expose their children to his profession. But he broke the vow, and John Jr. took his place as his father's Capo.
critical_consensus: Fuhgeddaboudit.
review: ['"John Henry" is a lead-footed revenge thriller that lands with all the subtlety of the mighty steel-driving man\'s sledgehammer.', 'A thug-life thriller so frequently preposterous that it almost resembles a parody.', "Crews is an actor with enough charisma and range to carry either gritty genre adventures or more cartoony showdowns; but Forbes' tonal uncertainty and a stiff script leave him stranded here...", "Flashes of craft can't make up for the director's easy default to gore over story.", "It never quite reaches its ambitious heights. It wants to be something, but it's kinda just a cheesy B-genre movie."]
